text:
The containsregexp selector doesn't support matches across multiple lines.
I tried to surround the expression with (?s: ... ) and (?-m: ... ), but matching still appears to occur line-by-line only.

creator: bodewig@apache.org
text:
Would it be better to support a flags attribute like the replaceregexp task or a
combo of singleline/multiline/casesensitive attributes like the matches
condition?

Ant isn't very consistent.  The regexpmapper has a casesensitive attribute, the
replaceregexp tokenfilter a flags attribute and the linecontainsregexp filter
lacks either (at least it should support casesensitive).

As far as I can see, neither is more powerful than the other, i.e. Ant skripts can map one to the other in terms of properties when required.

The boolean-valued attributes are probably more readable, though.

Consistency, in the sense that all regexp facilities support all flags (regardless of how they need to be specified), would be good.
